newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Ericsson says Europolitan deal worth 300 mln SKR.
newsitem.headline: Ericsson says Europolitan deal worth 300 mln SKR.

text.p: Swedish telecoms group Ericsson on Tuesday said a contract with mobile phone operator Europolitan was worth about 300 million crowns.
Ericsson spokesman Per Bengtsson said the supply contract that runs until 2000 was worth about that amount.
"It can be worth around 300 million crowns," Bengtsson said, after Ericsson announced the contract earlier on Tuesday.
He said Europolitan has two main competitors rivalling its licences for GSM and DSC 1800 networks and would remain secretive about whether there would be any extension to the contract.
The contract contains deliveries for radio base stations as well as operation and maintenance systems and is the first between Ericsson and Europolitan.
